t: Zechariah 1
A Call to Repentance
In*p the eighth month of the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord*s came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
“The Lord*s has been very angry with your fathers.
Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “Return to Me,” says the Lord*s of hosts, “and I will return to you,” says the Lord*s of hosts.

“Do not be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets preached, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “Turn now from your evil ways and your evil deeds.”’ But they did not hear nor heed Me,” says the Lord.*s
“Your*pn fathers, where are*i they? And*ld the prophets, do they live forever?

Yet*ld surely My words and My statutes, Which*ld I commanded My servants the prophets, Did*ld they not overtake your fathers? “So*p they returned and said: ‘Just*pn as the Lord*s of hosts determined to do to us, According*ld to our ways and according to our deeds, So*ld He has dealt with us.’”’”
Vision of the Horses
On*p the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord*s came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet:
I saw by night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and it stood among the myrtle trees in the hollow; and behind him were*i horses: red, sorrel, and white.
Then I said, “My lord, what are*i these?” So the angel who talked with me said to me, “I will show you what they are.”*i
And*p the man who stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, “These are*i the*i ones*i whom the Lord*s has sent to walk to and fro throughout the earth.”
So*p they answered the Angel of the Lord,*s who stood among the myrtle trees, and said, “We have walked to and fro throughout the earth, and behold, all the earth is resting quietly.”
The Lord Will Comfort Zion
Then*p the Angel of the Lord*s answered and said, “O Lord*s of hosts, how long will You not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which You were angry these seventy years?”
And*p the Lord*s answered the angel who talked to me, with*i good and*i comforting words.
So the angel who spoke with me said to me, “Proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “I*pn am zealous for Jerusalem And*ld for Zion with great zeal.
I*ld am exceedingly angry with the nations at ease; For*ld I was a little angry, And*ld they helped— but*i with evil intent.”*i

‘Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “I*pn am returning to Jerusalem with mercy; My*ld house shall be built in it,” says the Lord*s of hosts, “And*ld a surveyor’s*i line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.”’
“Again*p proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “My*pn cities shall again spread out through prosperity; The*ld Lord*s will again comfort Zion, And*ld will again choose Jerusalem.”’”
Vision of the Horns
Then*p I raised my eyes and looked, and there were*i four horns.
And I said to the angel who talked with me, “What are*i these?” So*p he answered me, “These are*i the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
Then*p the Lord*s showed me four craftsmen.

And I said, “What are these coming to do?” So*p he said, “These are*i the horns that scattered Judah, so that no one could lift up his head; but the craftsmen are coming to terrify them, to cast out the horns of the nations that lifted up their*i horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”
